page.title: 13Chinley-a local impression/3
page.content:
New trade is brought into the village by holiday-makers renting cottages. Perhaps they will return again and again, for few places are so friendly. Names and faces are rarely forgotten. You must never be in too much of a hurry when shopping. Everyone likes to get exactly what they want. And then the time of day can be passed at one of the many coffee mornings or during a visit to the library.
In conclusion, I would just like to add that I have lived here all my life, which gives me a great sense of pride and joy to say I am a true local.
{Enid M. Roberts
